p:
The decrease of peroxide formation and transition to superoxide formation is not observed in the DEMS measurements (Figureâ€… 3[
21 ,
22 ]). This is due to lower mass transport in the DEMS cell, while the large hysteresis concerning ORR for smooth electrodes in the DEMS cell already is an indication for the formation of the CaO 2/CaO film, as it is caused by the decrease in electrode activity. Therefore, we assume that the adsorbate layer formation is a slow reaction competitive to the formation of soluble peroxide. This experiment and the corresponding experiment on smooth gold
[29] identify the adsorbate as reason for inhibition of peroxide formation, which persists after slow dissolution of the thicker CaO 2 bulk layer formed during ORR.
